critique: The executive order discusses a serious situation in the Central African Republic involving violence, atrocities, and the use of child soldiers. The president aims to convey a sense of urgency and concern, highlighting the threat to national security and foreign policy. The order seeks to evoke feelings of fear and disgust related to the described events, and a sense of surprise at the severity of the situation. There is also an element of sadness related to the suffering of the people in the Central African Republic. The order does not aim to evoke joy.
